Column Comment.0: ACQUISITION DESIGN ID: Unique identifier for the acquisition design
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC RECEIVER SETUP ID: unique identifier for the seismic receiver setup.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AVERAGE FEATHERING ANGLE: the average feathering angle that was notedduring recording.
Column Comment.4: AVERAGE STREAMER DEPTH: Average depth of the marine streamer.
Column Comment.5: AVG STREAMER DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the Original units ofmeasure
Column Comment.6: BASE FREQUENCY: Natural resonant frequency of the geophone, in Hertz
Column Comment.7: DEPTH CONTROLLER: describes the depth controller used in marine acquisition.May be Spring controller, air pressure or hydrostatic pressure
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: FIXED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether these receivers have a fixedlocation. If they are fixed, set this flag to Y. If they are not fixed, set this flag to N.
Column Comment.11: GROUP SPACING: The distance between centers of receiver group arrays
Column Comment.12: GROUP SPACING ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the Original units of measure
Column Comment.13: INLINE OFFSET: the nominal inline offset that was used for receiver positioning (asin 50 meters from the flag)
Column Comment.14: INLINE OFFSET DIRECTION: The inlline direction that a station is offset forrecording. Indicated as a direction parallel to the direction of recording.
Column Comment.15: OFFLINE OFFSET: the nominal offline offset that was used for receiver positioning(as in 10 meters from the flag)
Column Comment.16: OFFLINE OFFSET DIRECTION: The direction in which the offline offset shot wasmoved. Indicated as a direction perpendicular to the direction of the line.
Column Comment.18: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.19: ARRAY TYPE: the type of receiver array used
Column Comment.20: SEISMIC RECEIVER INSTRUMENTS MAKE: make and model of the equipmentused.
Column Comment.21: RECEIVER PHONE COUNT: The number of phones in each receiver group
Column Comment.22: RECEIVER SPACING: Nominal distance between individual receivers in the array
Column Comment.23: RECEIVER SPACING ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the Original units ofmeasure
Column Comment.24: RECEIVER or GEOPHONE TYPE: A reference table identifying valid types ofgeophones used in either siesmic or VSP surveys.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, agency, application or other source designatedas the source of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: SPREAD DESCRIPTION: describes the spread configuration (1500-500-x-500-1500)
Column Comment.28: SPREAD DESCRIPTION ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the Original units ofmeasure used to describe the spread configuration.
Column Comment.29: STREAMER COUNT: The number of streamers used in marine recording
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
